Molecule Fragmentation (picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation)¶

class picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.groups.Groups(identifier)[source]¶

Group class. Stores the solved FragmentationModels subgroups of a molecule.

Parameters:

identifier (str or rdkit.rdchem.Mol) – The molecular identifier (SMILES string or RDKit Mol object).

Variables:

  • mol_object (Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The RDKit Mol object representing the molecule.

  • molecular_weight (float) – The molecular weight of the molecule.

  • unifac (Groups.SubgroupModel) – The SubgroupModel object for the UNIFAC model.

  • unifac_IL (Groups.SubgroupModel) – The SubgroupModel object for the UNIFAC-IL model.

radii()[source]¶

Calculates the van der Waals radii for each atom in the molecule using RDKit’s GetPeriodicTable.

Returns:

A list of van der Waals radii for each atom.

Return type:

List[float]

property vdw_molar_volume¶

Calculates the van der Waals molar volume in cm3/mol based on the atomic radii.

\[V_{vdw} = N_A \sum_i \frac{4}{3} \pi r_i^3\]
Returns:

The van der Waals molar volume in cm3/mol.

Return type:

float

property vdw_surface_area¶

Calculates the van der Waals surface area in cm2/mol based on the atomic radii.

\[SA_{vdw} = N_A \sum_i 4 \pi r_i^2\]
Returns:

The van der Waals surface area in cm2/mol.

Return type:

float

class SubgroupModel(identifier, model)[source]¶

Handles subgroup-related calculations for a specific UNIFAC model.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str or rdkit.rdchem.Mol) – The identifier of the molecule. This could be a SMILES string or rdkit.rdchem.Mol object.

  • model (FragmentationModel) – The fragmentation model instance containing the subgroup definitions and parameters.

Variables:

subgroups (dict) – A dictionary mapping subgroup names to their occurrences in the molecule.

property to_num¶

Converts subgroup names to subgroup IDs. Creates a dictionary mapping subgroup IDs to their occurrences in the molecule.

Returns:

A dictionary of subgroup IDs and their occurrences.

Return type:

dict

property r¶

Calculates the molar van der Waals volume parameter (\(r_i\)) for molecule \(i\), from the summation of volume parameters (\(R_j\)) for subgroup \(j\) multiplied by their occurrences.

\[r_i = \sum_j \nu_{ji} R_j\]
Returns:

molar van der Waals volume parameter.

Return type:

float

property q¶

Calculates the molar van der Waals surface area parameter (\(q_i\)) for molecule \(i\), from the summation of surface area parameters (\(Q_j\)) for subgroup \(j\) multiplied by their occurrences.

\[q_i = \sum_j \nu_{ji} Q_j\]
Returns:

molar van der Waals surface area parameter.

Return type:

float

property subgroup_q¶

Maps the surface area parameter (\(Q_j\)) for each subgroup \(j\) in molecule \(i\) to its corresponding subgroup ID.

Returns:

A dictionary of subgroup IDs and their Q values.

Return type:

dict[int, float]

class picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.fragmentation_models.fragmentation_model.FragmentationModel(subgroups: DataFrame, RQ: DataFrame, split_detection_smarts: List[str] = [], problematic_structures: DataFrame | None = None)[source]¶

A model for fragmenting molecules and analyzing their subgroups.

Parameters:

  • subgroups (pd.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame defining the molecular subgroups. The index of the DataFrame represents the subgroup IDs. It must contain columns named “smarts” and “contribute”.

  • RQ (pd.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame representing the subgroup R & Q UNIFAC terms.

  • split_detection_smarts (list[str], optional) – A list of subgroup identifiers (corresponding to the index in the subgroups DataFrame) for which the SMARTS patterns for detection are split into multiple patterns.

  • problematic_structures (pd.DataFrame or None, optional) – A pandas DataFrame describing problematic structural patterns. The index of the DataFrame contains SMARTS patterns, and the DataFrame must contain a column named “contribute”. The “contribute” column should contain string representations of dictionaries. These dictionaries map subgroup identifiers to the contribution factors for each problematic structure. If None, an empty DataFrame is created.

Variables:

  • contribution_matrix (pd.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame representing the contribution matrix, derived from the “contribute” column of the subgroups DataFrame.

  • detection_mols (dict) – A dictionary mapping subgroup IDs to lists of RDKit Mol objects, instantiated from the SMARTS patterns in the “smarts” column of the subgroups DataFrame. For subgroups in split_detection_smarts, the value is a list of multiple Mol objects.

  • fit_mols (dict[int, list[rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol]]) – A dictionary mapping subgroup IDs to lists of RDKit Mol objects, similar to detection_mols, but using the original SMARTS patterns from the “smarts” column of the subgroups DataFrame, even for subgroups in split_detection_smarts.

picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.get_rdkit_object.instantiate_mol_object(identifier: str | Mol) → Mol[source]¶

Instantiate a RDKit Mol object from SMILES or an existing Mol object.

Parameters:

identifier (str or Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The molecular identifier, either a SMILES string or an RDKit Mol object.

Returns:

An RDKit Mol object.

Return type:

Chem.rdchem.Mol

Raises:

ValueError – If the identifier type is invalid or if a mol type identifier is not an RDKit Mol object.

Note

The function is cached, so repeated calls with the same identifier will return the same Mol object.

picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.get_model_groups.group_matches(mol_object: Mol, group: str, model: FragmentationModel, action: str = 'detection') → tuple[source]¶

Calculates the substructure matches of a functional group in a molecule. This function uses the RDKit library to find substructure matches of a functional group in a given molecule.

Parameters:

  • mol_object (Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The RDKit Mol object in which to search for the group.

  • group (str) – The functional group to search for.

  • model (FragmentationModel) – The FragmentationModel containing the group definitions.

  • action (str, optional) – The action context (detection or fit). Default is detection.

Returns:

A tuple of tuples containing the atoms that participate in the group substructure. The length of the tuple equals the number of matches of the group in the molecule.

Return type:

tuple[tuple[str]]

Raises:

ValueError – If the action is not ‘detection’ or ‘fit’.

picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.get_model_groups.detect_groups(mol_object: Mol, model: FragmentationModel) → tuple[List[str], List[int]][source]¶

Identifies the functional groups present in a molecule, using the SMARTS representations defined in a FragmentationModel.

Parameters:

  • mol_object (Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The RDKit Mol object to analyze.

  • model (FragmentationModel) – The FragmentationModel containing the subgroup definitions.

Returns:

A tuple containing a list of detected group names and a list of their corresponding occurrences.

Return type:

tuple[List[str], List[int]]

picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.get_model_groups.get_groups(model: FragmentationModel, identifier: str | Mol) → dict[source]¶

Obtain subgroups from an RDKit Mol object based on the definitions in a FragmentationModel. It also handles problematic structures and returns corrected subgroup counts.

Parameters:

  • model (FragmentationModel) – The FragmentationModel containing the subgroup definitions.

  • identifier (str or Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The molecular identifier, either a SMILES string or an RDKit Mol object.

Returns:

A dictionary of subgroups names and their occurrences in the molecule.

Return type:

dict[str, int]

picmol.models.unifac_subgroups.fragmentation.problematics.correct_problematics(mol_object: Mol, mol_subgroups: dict, model: FragmentationModel) → dict[source]¶

Identifies and corrects problematic structural patterns within a molecule by adjusting the counts of its subgroups. It uses a fragmentation model to determine which substructures are problematic and how their contributions should be redistributed.

Parameters:

  • mol_object (Chem.rdchem.Mol) – The molecule to be corrected, represented as an RDKit Mol object.

  • mol_subgroups (dict[str, int]) – A dictionary containing the initial counts of subgroups in the molecule. The keys are subgroup identifiers (e.g., SMARTS strings), and the values are their corresponding counts.

  • model (FragmentationModel) – Instance of the FragmentationModel containing the definitions of problematic structures and their contributions to the subgroups.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the corrected subgroup counts. The keys are subgroup identifiers, and the values are their corrected counts. Subgroups with a final count of 0 are removed from the dictionary.

Return type:

dict[str, int]
